states.name: Alabama
states.topIndustries: Aerospace & Defense, Automotive Manufacturing, Agriculture, Healthcare
states.majorEmployers: Redstone Arsenal, UAB, Hyundai, Honda, Mercedes-Benz
states.funFact1: The Saturn V rocket that carried astronauts to the Moon was developed at NASA's Marshall Space Flight Center in Huntsville
states.funFact2: Gulf Shores and Orange Beach attract over 6 million visitors annually with 32 miles of white-sand coastline
states.funFact3: The first 911 emergency call in the U.S. was made in Haleyville, Alabama on February 16, 1968

states.name: Alaska
states.topIndustries: Oil & Gas, Fishing & Seafood, Tourism, Mining, Federal Government
states.majorEmployers: State of Alaska, U.S. Military (JBER), Providence Health, ConocoPhillips
states.funFact1: Denali is the highest peak in North America at 20,310 feet, attracting climbers and tourists from around the world
states.funFact2: Alaska was purchased from Russia in 1867 for $7.2 million (~2 cents/acre), a deal called 'Seward's Folly'
states.funFact3: Alaska has more coastline than all other U.S. states combined, totaling approximately 6,640 miles

states.name: Arizona
states.topIndustries: Technology, Aerospace & Defense, Tourism, Real Estate, Copper Mining
states.majorEmployers: Banner Health, Raytheon, Intel, Arizona State University, Walmart
states.funFact1: The Grand Canyon, one of the Seven Natural Wonders of the World, attracts nearly 6 million visitors annually
states.funFact2: The Petrified Forest National Park contains 225-million-year-old fossilized trees across a painted desert
states.funFact3: Most of Arizona does not observe Daylight Saving Time, one of only two states to opt out (with Hawaii)

states.name: Arkansas
states.topIndustries: Agriculture (Poultry & Rice), Retail (Walmart HQ), Transportation, Food Processing
states.majorEmployers: Walmart (HQ), Tyson Foods, J.B. Hunt Transport, University of Arkansas
states.funFact1: Walmart, the world's largest company by revenue, was founded by Sam Walton in Rogers, Arkansas in 1962
states.funFact2: Crater of Diamonds State Park is the only diamond-producing site in the world open to the public
states.funFact3: Hot Springs National Park, established in 1832, is the oldest federally protected area in the National Park System

states.name: California
states.topIndustries: Technology, Entertainment, Agriculture, International Trade, Tourism, Biotech
states.majorEmployers: Apple, Google/Alphabet, Meta, Walt Disney, Kaiser Permanente, UC System
states.funFact1: If California were a country, its $4.1 trillion GDP would rank as the 5th largest economy in the world
states.funFact2: Yosemite National Park's iconic granite cliffs and waterfalls attract over 3.8 million visitors annually
states.funFact3: The 1849 Gold Rush brought 300,000 people to California and helped accelerate its statehood in 1850

states.name: Colorado
states.topIndustries: Technology, Aerospace, Renewable Energy, Tourism (Skiing), Agriculture, Cannabis
states.majorEmployers: Lockheed Martin, Ball Corporation, DISH Network, University of Colorado, Centura Health
states.funFact1: Colorado has the lowest adult obesity rate in the U.S. at 25.0% according to 2024 CDC BRFSS data
states.funFact2: Rocky Mountain National Park spans over 415 sq mi and includes 77 peaks above 12,000 feet
states.funFact3: The U.S. Air Force Academy in Colorado Springs has trained military officers since 1954

states.name: Connecticut
states.topIndustries: Insurance, Finance, Defense (Submarines), Pharmaceuticals, Higher Education
states.majorEmployers: RTX (United Technologies), Cigna, Yale University, Hartford Financial, Sikorsky
states.funFact1: Hartford has been called the 'Insurance Capital of the World,' home to Aetna, The Hartford, and other major insurers
states.funFact2: Yale University, founded in 1701, is the third-oldest institution of higher education in the U.S.
states.funFact3: The first American cookbook, 'American Cookery' by Amelia Simmons, was published in Hartford in 1796

states.name: Delaware
states.topIndustries: Financial Services, Chemical Manufacturing, Pharmaceuticals, Agriculture (Poultry)
states.majorEmployers: DuPont, JPMorgan Chase, Bank of America, Christiana Care, AstraZeneca
states.funFact1: Delaware was the first state to ratify the U.S. Constitution on December 7, 1787, earning the nickname 'The First State'
states.funFact2: Over 67% of Fortune 500 companies are incorporated in Delaware due to its business-friendly corporate laws
states.funFact3: Rehoboth Beach is known as 'The Nation's Summer Capital' due to its popularity with D.C. visitors

states.name: Florida
states.topIndustries: Tourism, Agriculture (Citrus), Aerospace, International Trade, Real Estate, Healthcare
states.majorEmployers: Walt Disney World, Universal, Publix, AdventHealth, Lockheed Martin, NextEra Energy
states.funFact1: Walt Disney World in Orlando is the most visited theme park resort in the world with over 58M annual visitors
states.funFact2: Kennedy Space Center on Merritt Island has been the primary launch site for NASA human spaceflight since 1968
states.funFact3: Florida has the fastest-growing state population in the U.S. at 1.96% annual growth (2024 Census estimate)

states.name: Georgia
states.topIndustries: Film & Entertainment, Logistics, Technology, Agriculture, Finance
states.majorEmployers: Delta Air Lines, The Home Depot (HQ), UPS, Coca-Cola (HQ), Emory University
states.funFact1: Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport has been the world's busiest airport by passengers for over two decades
states.funFact2: Martin Luther King Jr. was born in Atlanta; his birthplace is now a National Historical Park
states.funFact3: Georgia has become the 'Hollywood of the South,' producing more films than any state except California

states.name: Hawaii
states.topIndustries: Tourism, Military/Defense, Agriculture (Coffee, Macadamia), Research
states.majorEmployers: U.S. Military (Pearl Harbor), Hawaiian Airlines, Kamehameha Schools, Queens Health
states.funFact1: Hawaii is the only U.S. state composed entirely of islands, spanning 1,500 miles across the Pacific
states.funFact2: Pearl Harbor, site of the Dec 7, 1941 attack that brought the U.S. into WWII, is visited by 1.8M people annually
states.funFact3: Hawaii has the highest life expectancy of any U.S. state at 80.7 years

states.name: Idaho
states.topIndustries: Technology, Agriculture (Potatoes), Food Processing, Lumber, Mining
states.majorEmployers: Micron Technology, HP Inc., Albertsons (HQ), St. Luke's Health System, Simplot
states.funFact1: Idaho produces approximately one-third of all potatoes grown in the United States
states.funFact2: Craters of the Moon National Monument preserves a volcanic landscape used by NASA to train Apollo astronauts
states.funFact3: Hells Canyon on the Idaho-Oregon border is the deepest river gorge in North America at 7,913 feet

states.name: Illinois
states.topIndustries: Financial Services, Manufacturing, Agriculture (Corn, Soybeans), Technology, Transportation
states.majorEmployers: Abbott Labs, Caterpillar, McDonald's (HQ), United Airlines, Deere & Company
states.funFact1: Chicago's Willis Tower (formerly Sears Tower) was the tallest building in the world from 1973 to 1998
states.funFact2: Abraham Lincoln served as an Illinois legislator before becoming the 16th president; his home is a National Historic Site
states.funFact3: The first nuclear chain reaction was achieved at the University of Chicago in 1942 under the Manhattan Project

states.name: Indiana
states.topIndustries: Advanced Manufacturing, Pharmaceuticals, Motorsports, Agriculture, Logistics
states.majorEmployers: Eli Lilly (HQ), Cummins, Elevance Health, Indiana University Health, Rolls-Royce
states.funFact1: The Indianapolis 500, first held in 1911, is one of the oldest and most prestigious auto races in the world
states.funFact2: Eli Lilly, HQ'd in Indianapolis, is one of the world's largest pharma companies and major GLP-1 drug producer
states.funFact3: Santa Claus, Indiana receives thousands of letters addressed to Santa each year via a dedicated post office

states.name: Iowa
states.topIndustries: Agriculture (Corn, Hogs), Insurance, Manufacturing, Renewable Energy (Wind), Food Processing
states.majorEmployers: Principal Financial Group, John Deere, Hy-Vee, UnityPoint Health, MercyOne
states.funFact1: Iowa is the #1 producer of corn and hogs in the U.S., generating over $30 billion in agricultural receipts annually
states.funFact2: The Iowa Caucuses have traditionally been the first major electoral event in the presidential nominating process since 1972
states.funFact3: The Field of Dreams movie site in Dyersville now hosts an annual MLB game and attracts thousands of visitors

states.name: Kansas
states.topIndustries: Aviation/Aerospace Manufacturing, Agriculture (Wheat), Oil & Gas, Food Processing
states.majorEmployers: Spirit AeroSystems, Textron Aviation (Cessna/Beechcraft), Koch Industries, Cargill
states.funFact1: Wichita is known as the 'Air Capital of the World,' home to Cessna, Beechcraft, and other aircraft manufacturers
states.funFact2: Kansas is the #1 wheat-producing state in the U.S., earning the nickname 'The Breadbasket of America'
states.funFact3: Dodge City was one of the most famous frontier towns of the Old West and inspired the TV show 'Gunsmoke'

states.name: Kentucky
states.topIndustries: Bourbon Distilling, Automotive (Toyota), Coal Mining, Agriculture (Tobacco, Horses)
states.majorEmployers: Toyota (Georgetown), UPS Worldport (Louisville), Humana (HQ), University of Kentucky
states.funFact1: The Kentucky Derby at Churchill Downs, held annually since 1875, is the oldest continuously held horse race in the U.S.
states.funFact2: Kentucky produces approximately 95% of the world's bourbon whiskey supply
states.funFact3: Fort Knox holds roughly 4,580 tons of gold bullion—about half of U.S. Treasury stored gold reserves

states.name: Louisiana
states.topIndustries: Oil & Gas, Petrochemicals, Tourism, Shipping/Ports, Agriculture, Seafood
states.majorEmployers: Ochsner Health, Port of South Louisiana, Turner Industries, LCMC Health
states.funFact1: New Orleans' Mardi Gras, held annually since 1857, draws over 1 million visitors each year
states.funFact2: The Louisiana Purchase in 1803 doubled the size of the U.S.—Jefferson bought it from France for $15 million
states.funFact3: Louisiana is the only U.S. state that uses the Napoleonic Code as the basis for its civil law system

states.name: Maine
states.topIndustries: Tourism, Lobster Fishing, Forestry/Paper, Healthcare, Blueberries, Shipbuilding
states.majorEmployers: Bath Iron Works, L.L. Bean, MaineHealth, Jackson Laboratory, University of Maine
states.funFact1: Maine produces approximately 80% of the U.S. lobster supply, harvesting over 100 million pounds annually
states.funFact2: Acadia National Park on Mount Desert Island was the first national park east of the Mississippi River
states.funFact3: Maine is the only U.S. state that borders exactly one other state (New Hampshire)

states.name: Maryland
states.topIndustries: Federal Government/Defense, Biotechnology, Cybersecurity, Healthcare, Higher Education
states.majorEmployers: Johns Hopkins, NIH, NSA, Fort Meade, Lockheed Martin, Marriott International
states.funFact1: 'The Star-Spangled Banner' was written by Francis Scott Key during the 1814 Battle of Baltimore at Fort McHenry
states.funFact2: Johns Hopkins Hospital has been ranked among the top hospitals in the U.S. for decades
states.funFact3: The Chesapeake Bay, the largest estuary in the U.S., is famous for Maryland blue crab

states.name: Massachusetts
states.topIndustries: Biotechnology/Pharma, Higher Education, Technology, Financial Services, Healthcare
states.majorEmployers: Mass General Brigham, Harvard, MIT, Fidelity Investments, Raytheon
states.funFact1: Massachusetts has the highest median household income in the U.S. at ~$113,870 (2024 ACS)
states.funFact2: Harvard University, founded in 1636, is the oldest institution of higher learning in the United States
states.funFact3: The Boston Tea Party of 1773, a pivotal event leading to the American Revolution, took place in Boston Harbor

states.name: Michigan
states.topIndustries: Automotive Manufacturing, Technology, Agriculture (Cherries), Tourism, Healthcare
states.majorEmployers: General Motors, Ford Motor Co., Stellantis, University of Michigan, Beaumont Health
states.funFact1: Detroit is known as the 'Motor City' and the birthplace of the modern American automobile industry
states.funFact2: Michigan borders four of the five Great Lakes and has the longest freshwater coastline of any state
states.funFact3: Motown Records, founded by Berry Gordy in Detroit in 1959, launched Stevie Wonder, The Supremes, and more

states.name: Minnesota
states.topIndustries: Healthcare (Mayo Clinic), Finance, Agriculture, Manufacturing, Mining (Iron Ore), Tech
states.majorEmployers: Mayo Clinic, UnitedHealth Group (HQ), Target (HQ), 3M (HQ), General Mills, Medtronic
states.funFact1: The Mall of America in Bloomington is the largest mall in the U.S. with 5.6M sq ft and 500+ stores
states.funFact2: Minnesota is the 'Land of 10,000 Lakes' though it actually has 11,842 lakes over 10 acres in size
states.funFact3: The Mayo Clinic in Rochester is consistently ranked the #1 hospital in the U.S. by U.S. News

states.name: Mississippi
states.topIndustries: Agriculture (Cotton, Catfish), Manufacturing, Energy, Forestry, Shipbuilding
states.majorEmployers: Ingalls Shipbuilding, Nissan (Canton), UMMC, Sanderson Farms, Mississippi State Univ.
states.funFact1: Mississippi has the lowest life expectancy (71.9 years) and highest obesity rate (40.4%) of any U.S. state
states.funFact2: The blues music genre originated in the Mississippi Delta; Clarksdale is considered the birthplace of the blues
states.funFact3: Vicksburg National Military Park preserves the site of the pivotal 1863 Civil War siege

states.name: Missouri
states.topIndustries: Agriculture, Aerospace/Defense, Financial Services, Healthcare, Automotive, Beer Brewing
states.majorEmployers: Cerner (Oracle Health), Edward Jones, Anheuser-Busch, BJC HealthCare, Emerson Electric
states.funFact1: The Gateway Arch in St. Louis, at 630 feet, is the tallest human-made monument in the United States
states.funFact2: The Lewis and Clark Expedition departed from near St. Louis in May 1804 to explore the Louisiana Purchase
states.funFact3: Kansas City is famous for its barbecue tradition with over 100 BBQ restaurants in the metro area

states.name: Montana
states.topIndustries: Agriculture (Cattle, Wheat), Mining, Tourism, Timber, Energy
states.majorEmployers: Billings Clinic, Providence St. Joseph Health, U.S. Forest Service, Montana State Univ.
states.funFact1: Glacier National Park is known as the 'Crown of the Continent' with over 700 miles of hiking trails
states.funFact2: Montana's 'Big Sky Country' nickname reflects the state having one of the lowest population densities at 8 people per sq mi
states.funFact3: The Battle of the Little Bighorn (1876), where Lakota and Cheyenne defeated Custer, took place in southern Montana

states.name: Nebraska
states.topIndustries: Agriculture (Beef, Corn), Insurance, Finance, Manufacturing, Transportation
states.majorEmployers: Berkshire Hathaway (HQ), Union Pacific Railroad (HQ), Mutual of Omaha, ConAgra
states.funFact1: Berkshire Hathaway, Warren Buffett's holding company, is HQ'd in Omaha with a market cap over $1 trillion
states.funFact2: Nebraska is the only state with a unicameral (one-house) legislature, adopted in 1937
states.funFact3: Chimney Rock, a geological formation along the Oregon Trail, was the most referenced landmark by westward pioneers

states.name: Nevada
states.topIndustries: Tourism/Gaming, Mining (Gold, Silver), Logistics, Technology (Data Centers), Solar Energy
states.majorEmployers: MGM Resorts, Caesars Entertainment, Las Vegas Sands, Wynn Resorts, Switch
states.funFact1: Las Vegas hosts over 40 million visitors per year and generates more than $15 billion in annual gaming revenue
states.funFact2: Nevada produces more gold than any other U.S. state, accounting for about 72% of domestic gold output
states.funFact3: Hoover Dam, completed in 1936 on the Nevada-Arizona border, was the largest dam in the world at its completion

states.name: New Hampshire
states.topIndustries: Technology, Manufacturing, Tourism, Healthcare, Higher Education
states.majorEmployers: Dartmouth-Hitchcock, BAE Systems, Liberty Mutual, Fidelity, University of New Hampshire
states.funFact1: New Hampshire holds the first-in-the-nation presidential primary election, a tradition since 1920
states.funFact2: The White Mountains' Mount Washington recorded the highest wind speed ever observed on Earth's surface (231 mph in 1934)
states.funFact3: New Hampshire has no state income tax and no state sales tax, one of few states with neither

states.name: New Jersey
states.topIndustries: Pharmaceuticals, Financial Services, Technology, Tourism (Shore), Food Processing
states.majorEmployers: Johnson & Johnson (HQ), Merck, Prudential Financial, Rutgers University, RWJBarnabas Health
states.funFact1: New Jersey is home to more pharmaceutical companies than any other state, earning the title 'Medicine Chest of the World'
states.funFact2: The Jersey Shore stretches 141 miles and includes iconic boardwalk communities like Atlantic City and Asbury Park
states.funFact3: Thomas Edison's laboratory in Menlo Park (now Edison, NJ) produced the phonograph and practical incandescent lightbulb

states.name: New Mexico
states.topIndustries: Oil & Gas, Government/Military (National Labs), Tourism, Agriculture, Mining
states.majorEmployers: Sandia National Laboratories, Los Alamos National Lab, Kirtland AFB, University of NM
states.funFact1: Santa Fe, founded in 1610, is the oldest state capital in the United States
states.funFact2: The world's first nuclear weapon was detonated at the Trinity test site in southern New Mexico on July 16, 1945
states.funFact3: Carlsbad Caverns contain over 100 limestone caves, including one of the world's largest underground chambers

states.name: New York
states.topIndustries: Financial Services (Wall Street), Media/Entertainment, Technology, Healthcare, Tourism
states.majorEmployers: JPMorgan Chase, Citigroup, Goldman Sachs, NYC Health+Hospitals, Mount Sinai, IBM
states.funFact1: New York City's Statue of Liberty welcomed over 12 million immigrants through nearby Ellis Island (1892–1954)
states.funFact2: Wall Street in Manhattan is the world's largest financial center by total market capitalization
states.funFact3: New York has the 3rd largest state GDP at $2.3 trillion and the highest GDP per capita of any state at $117,332

states.name: North Carolina
states.topIndustries: Banking/Finance (Charlotte), Technology (Research Triangle), Agriculture (Tobacco, Hogs), Biotech
states.majorEmployers: Bank of America (HQ Charlotte), Duke University, Lowe's, Duke Energy, Novant Health
states.funFact1: The Research Triangle (Raleigh-Durham-Chapel Hill) is one of the top biotech and tech hubs in the U.S.
states.funFact2: The Wright Brothers achieved the first powered airplane flight at Kitty Hawk, NC on December 17, 1903
states.funFact3: The Blue Ridge Parkway, 'America's Favorite Drive,' runs 469 miles through the NC/VA mountains

states.name: North Dakota
states.topIndustries: Oil & Gas (Bakken Formation), Agriculture (Wheat, Sunflowers), Energy, Food Processing
states.majorEmployers: Sanford Health, Essentia Health, Hess Corporation, Bobcat Company, Microsoft (data centers)
states.funFact1: North Dakota's Bakken Formation oil boom made it the 2nd largest oil-producing state in the U.S.
states.funFact2: Theodore Roosevelt National Park preserves the rugged Badlands landscape that inspired TR's conservation legacy
states.funFact3: North Dakota has one of the lowest unemployment rates in the nation, consistently below 3%

states.name: Ohio
states.topIndustries: Manufacturing, Healthcare, Financial Services, Technology, Agriculture, Automotive
states.majorEmployers: Cleveland Clinic, Ohio State University, Procter & Gamble (HQ), Kroger (HQ), Honda
states.funFact1: Ohio has produced eight U.S. presidents, more than any other state except Virginia
states.funFact2: The Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in Cleveland celebrates the history and artists of rock music
states.funFact3: Ohio is home to the Wright Brothers (Dayton), Neil Armstrong (Wapakoneta), and John Glenn (Cambridge)—pioneers of flight and space

states.name: Oklahoma
states.topIndustries: Oil & Gas, Agriculture, Aerospace, Weather Research, Military/Defense
states.majorEmployers: Tinker Air Force Base, University of Oklahoma, Devon Energy, Continental Resources
states.funFact1: Oklahoma City's National Memorial & Museum honors the 168 victims of the 1995 Alfred P. Murrah bombing
states.funFact2: Oklahoma sits in 'Tornado Alley' and is home to the National Weather Service's Storm Prediction Center in Norman
states.funFact3: The state has the largest Native American population (percentage-wise) of any state, with 39 tribal nations

states.name: Oregon
states.topIndustries: Technology (Silicon Forest), Forestry/Timber, Agriculture (Wine, Hazelnuts), Tourism, Manufacturing
states.majorEmployers: Nike (HQ), Intel, OHSU, Providence Health, Columbia Sportswear
states.funFact1: Nike, the world's largest athletic footwear and apparel company, is headquartered in Beaverton, Oregon
states.funFact2: Crater Lake, formed by a volcanic eruption ~7,700 years ago, is the deepest lake in the U.S. at 1,943 feet
states.funFact3: Oregon has no state sales tax, making it a popular shopping destination for residents of neighboring states

states.name: Pennsylvania
states.topIndustries: Healthcare, Financial Services, Manufacturing, Energy (Natural Gas), Agriculture, Education
states.majorEmployers: UPMC, Penn Medicine, Comcast (HQ), University of Pennsylvania, Hershey Company
states.funFact1: Philadelphia was the site of the signing of the Declaration of Independence (1776) and the U.S. Constitution (1787)
states.funFact2: Gettysburg was the site of the Civil War's bloodiest battle (1863), where Lincoln delivered his famous Address
states.funFact3: Hershey, Pennsylvania is known as 'The Sweetest Place on Earth' and is HQ to the Hershey Company

states.name: Rhode Island
states.topIndustries: Healthcare, Education, Defense (Naval Station Newport), Tourism, Manufacturing, Jewelry
states.majorEmployers: CVS Health (HQ), Brown University, Lifespan, Care New England, Electric Boat
states.funFact1: Rhode Island is the smallest U.S. state by area at just 1,545 square miles but has the highest population density after NJ
states.funFact2: Newport's Gilded Age mansions, like The Breakers (built by the Vanderbilts), attract 3.5 million visitors annually
states.funFact3: Rhode Island was founded by Roger Williams in 1636 as a haven for religious freedom and separation of church and state

states.name: South Carolina
states.topIndustries: Automotive (BMW, Volvo), Aerospace, Tourism (Myrtle Beach), Agriculture, Military
states.majorEmployers: BMW (Spartanburg), Boeing (Charleston), Prisma Health, MUSC, Volvo Cars
states.funFact1: The first shots of the Civil War were fired at Fort Sumter in Charleston Harbor on April 12, 1861
states.funFact2: Myrtle Beach's 60-mile Grand Strand is one of the most visited beach destinations in the U.S.
states.funFact3: BMW's largest manufacturing plant in the world is located in Spartanburg, SC, producing over 1,500 vehicles per day

states.name: South Dakota
states.topIndustries: Agriculture (Cattle, Corn), Tourism, Financial Services (Credit Cards), Mining, Healthcare
states.majorEmployers: Sanford Health, Citibank (Sioux Falls operations), Avera Health, Ellsworth AFB
states.funFact1: Mount Rushmore features the carved faces of four U.S. presidents and attracts about 2.5 million visitors annually
states.funFact2: The Crazy Horse Memorial, when completed, will be the world's largest sculpture at 563 feet high
states.funFact3: South Dakota has no state personal income tax, making it an attractive state for individuals and credit card companies

states.name: Tennessee
states.topIndustries: Healthcare (Nashville is 'Healthcare Capital'), Music, Automotive, Tourism, Agriculture
states.majorEmployers: HCA Healthcare (HQ), FedEx (HQ Memphis), Vanderbilt University, Nissan, Amazon
states.funFact1: Nashville is known as 'Music City' and is the home of country music, the Grand Ole Opry, and major record labels
states.funFact2: Graceland in Memphis, Elvis Presley's home, is the second most-visited private residence in the U.S. after the White House
states.funFact3: Nashville is the healthcare capital of the U.S., with over 500 healthcare companies generating $92B+ in revenue

states.name: Texas
states.topIndustries: Oil & Gas, Technology, Aerospace, Agriculture, Healthcare, Financial Services
states.majorEmployers: ExxonMobil, AT&T, Dell, Texas Instruments, HEB, MD Anderson Cancer Center
states.funFact1: Texas is the 2nd largest state by both population (32.4M) and GDP ($2.7 trillion), behind only California
states.funFact2: The Alamo in San Antonio is one of America's most iconic historic sites, drawing 2.5 million visitors annually
states.funFact3: NASA's Johnson Space Center in Houston has been Mission Control for every U.S. human spaceflight since 1965

states.name: Utah
states.topIndustries: Technology (Silicon Slopes), Tourism (National Parks), Aerospace, Mining, Healthcare
states.majorEmployers: Intermountain Health, University of Utah, Hill AFB, Goldman Sachs, Adobe
states.funFact1: Utah's 'Mighty Five' national parks (Arches, Bryce Canyon, Canyonlands, Capitol Reef, Zion) draw 15M+ visitors annually
states.funFact2: Utah's 'Silicon Slopes' tech corridor is one of the fastest-growing tech hubs in the U.S.
states.funFact3: The 2002 Winter Olympics were held in Salt Lake City, which is bidding to host again in 2034

states.name: Vermont
states.topIndustries: Tourism (Skiing, Foliage), Dairy Farming, Manufacturing, Technology, Maple Syrup
states.majorEmployers: University of Vermont Medical Center, GlobalFoundries, Vermont Country Store, Cabot Creamery
states.funFact1: Vermont is the largest producer of maple syrup in the U.S., accounting for about 50% of domestic production
states.funFact2: Ben & Jerry's ice cream was founded in Burlington, Vermont in 1978 in a renovated gas station
states.funFact3: Montpelier is the smallest state capital in the U.S. by population (~8,000) and the only one without a McDonald's

states.name: Virginia
states.topIndustries: Federal Government/Defense, Technology (NoVA), Agriculture, Tourism, Shipbuilding
states.majorEmployers: U.S. Government (Pentagon, CIA), Amazon (HQ2), Northrop Grumman, Inova Health, Navy
states.funFact1: Virginia is known as the 'Mother of Presidents,' having produced 8 U.S. presidents including Washington and Jefferson
states.funFact2: Arlington National Cemetery is the final resting place for over 400,000 military veterans and their families
states.funFact3: Amazon's HQ2 in Arlington (Crystal City) brought 25,000+ high-paying tech jobs to Northern Virginia

states.name: Washington
states.topIndustries: Technology, Aerospace (Boeing), Agriculture, International Trade, Clean Energy
states.majorEmployers: Microsoft (HQ), Amazon (HQ), Boeing, Starbucks (HQ), Costco (HQ), University of Washington
states.funFact1: Washington state is HQ to five Fortune 500 companies: Microsoft, Amazon, Costco, Starbucks, and Paccar
states.funFact2: Mount Rainier, an active volcano and the most glaciated peak in the contiguous U.S., stands at 14,411 feet
states.funFact3: Seattle's Pike Place Market, opened in 1907, is one of the oldest continuously operated farmers' markets in the U.S.

states.name: West Virginia
states.topIndustries: Coal Mining, Natural Gas, Chemicals, Tourism, Timber, Healthcare
states.majorEmployers: WVU Medicine, Charleston Area Medical Center, Dow Chemical, Toyota (Buffalo plant)
states.funFact1: West Virginia has the highest adult obesity rate in the nation at 41.4% (2024 BRFSS data)
states.funFact2: The New River Gorge Bridge, 876 feet above the river, became America's newest national park in 2020
states.funFact3: West Virginia became a state in 1863 by seceding from Virginia during the Civil War—the only state formed by seceding from a Confederate state

states.name: Wisconsin
states.topIndustries: Manufacturing, Agriculture (Dairy, Cranberries), Insurance, Paper/Packaging, Healthcare
states.majorEmployers: Epic Systems, Northwestern Mutual, SC Johnson, Harley-Davidson, Oshkosh Corp, Kohler
states.funFact1: Wisconsin produces more cheese than any other state, earning the nickname 'America's Dairyland'
states.funFact2: The Green Bay Packers are the only community-owned franchise in major American professional sports
states.funFact3: Epic Systems in Verona, WI develops software used by hospitals serving over 250 million patients worldwide

states.name: Wyoming
states.topIndustries: Mining (Coal, Trona), Oil & Gas, Tourism, Agriculture (Cattle), Wind Energy
states.majorEmployers: State of Wyoming, University of Wyoming, Cloud Peak Energy, Arch Resources
states.funFact1: Yellowstone (est. 1872) was the world's first national park and spans 2.2 million acres with geothermal features
states.funFact2: Wyoming is the least populous U.S. state with ~593,000 residents but one of the highest GDPs per capita at ~$90,800
states.funFact3: Wyoming was the first U.S. state/territory to grant women the right to vote, doing so in 1869—51 years before the 19th Amendment
